sources.title: Bless 'em All [1949]
sources.description: Bless 'Em All   is a 1948 British  musical comedy  film directed by  Robert Jordan Hill  and starring Hal Monty and  Max Bygraves , the latter in his screen debut.   The film is about three men who meet when they are called up for the Second World War and fight together in the Battle of France. Five scriptwriters pooled their talents on the 79-minute British programmer  Bless  ' Em All . The stars are radio and music-hall favorites. Songs:  Coming your way... "Bless 'em All" The soldier's farewell to the blues. Don't miss your issue of 'Rookie Roars' "Bless 'em All". It's gag-packed, song-stacked. It stars Hal Monty in "Bless 'em All".
